author: Carly Apar
title: Steiner Sports COO | Tourneau chief marketing officer | Verve Mobile CMO
text:
July 1, 2015 Updated 07/01/2015 Executive Moves Steiner Sports COO | Tourneau chief marketing officer | Verve Mobile CMO Companies with executive moves this week include Langan Engineering & Environmental Services, Viacom Music and Entertainment Group, Turner Broadcasting, Movable Ink and the Center for Real Estate at Rutgers Business School. Comments Email Print Ã— 
Society of Memorial Sloan Kettering: Lavinia Branca Snyder , 57, was named president of the MSK volunteer organization, which supports cancer research and education. She was previously the chair of several committees for the organization, as well as the founder of the JAR Project Space contemporary-art gallery. Langan Engineering & Environmental Services: Andrew Ciancia , 68, was appointed chairman. He continues as managing partner of the company. Viacom Music and Entertainment Group: Meghann Wu, 35, was promoted to senior vice president for strategy and business development. Turner Broadcasting: Frank Kavilanz , 42, joined the media company as vice president for social and mobile strategy. He was previously general manager of partnerships and sales at Bedrocket Media Ventures. Movable Ink: Brian Winters , 47, joined the digital marketing company as vice president of partnerships, alliances and channels. He was previously director of partner programs, global alliances and channels, at Salesforce/ExactTarget. Center for Real Estate at Rutgers Business School: Michael Hedden , 60, was named a founding member of the advisory board. He continues as managing director in the real estate and infrastructure solutions practice at FTI Consulting. Steiner Sports: Kelvin Joseph , 36, was promoted to chief operating officer at the marketing firm. He was previously chief financial officer. Fidelis Care: Brian Baker , 41, joined the health insurance company as vice president of finance. He was previously chief financial officer and corporate secretary at Medical Action Industries Inc. MainStay Investments: Dana Hartwell , 47, joined the asset-management firm as senior regional vice president. He was previously head of national accounts focused on defined-contribution investments at Hartford Funds. Winick Realty Group: Michael Gleicher, 29, was promoted to executive vice president and partner. He was previously a licensed salesperson. Tourneau: Katherine Bahamonde Monasebian , 37, joinedthe luxury watch retailer as chief marketing officer and head of new business development. She was previously chief marketing officer and executive vice president at C. Wonder. City National Bank: Anthony Savino, 39, joined as a senior vice president and senior private banker. He was previously a private banker at Morgan Stanley. Alan Wolberg, 53, joined as a senior vice president and senior wealth planner. He was previously a director and senior wealth strategist at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. Carolyn J. Finer, 47, joined as a private investment consultant. She was previously a private wealth adviser and senior portfolio manager at UBS Financial services. Verve Mobile: Julie Bernard , 45, joined the mobile platform as chief marketing officer. She was previously senior vice president of customer strategy at Macy's. Spongecell: Michael Nevins, 53, joined the advertising technology company as vice president, global marketing. He was previously vice president for mobile at Undertone. Kilpatrick Townsend: David Posner , 52, joined the law firm as a partner in the litigation department and will lead the bankruptcy and financial restructuring team in New York. He was previously a partner at Otterbourg. Health Management Associates: Heidi Arthur , 43, joined the health care consulting firm as a principal. She was previously vice president at SAE & Associates. Meggan Schilkie , 34, joined as a principal. She was previously chief program officer for mental health at the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene. FCB: Susan Credle, 51, joined the marketing communications company as global chief creative officer. She was previously chief creative officer at Leo Burnett USA. NYU Lutheran Medical Center: Bret Rudy, 56, was promoted to chief medical officer. He was previously vice chair of NYU Langone Medical Center's Department of Pediatrics. GuardHill Financial Corp.: Chris Reyes, 42, joined the residential mortgage banker and brokerage as chief technology officer. He was previously managing director of technology at Town Residential. Tectonic: Stan Fischer, 63, joined the technology and business services company as regional director of sales. He was previously managing director at Vestlynx. Berman Group: Jim Storey, 56, joined the corporate communications firm as business development manager. He was previously integrated media accounts manager at Dodge Data & Analytics. Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr: Anjan Sahni , 40, joined the law firm as a partner. He was previously chief of the Securities and Commodities Fraud Task Force at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. JAMS: Andrew Aglionby , 53, joined the mediation and arbitration service as a neutral. He was previously head of arbitration at Olswang. Norton Rose Fulbright: Mitchell Lubart, 61, joined the global legal practice as a partner. He was previously a partner at Hogan Lovells. Seyfarth Shaw: Gabriel Monzon-Cortarelli, 41, joined the international law firm as a partner in its corporate department. He was previously a shareholder in the corporate and securities practice and head of the Italian desk at Greenberg Traurig. A version of this article appears in the June 29, 2015, print issue of Crain's New York Business.
